be.hogent.tarsos.util
Class AudioTranscoder

java.lang.Object
  be.hogent.tarsos.util.AudioTranscoder

public class AudioTranscoder
extends java.lang.Object

Author:
Joren Six Transcodes audio. Uses ffmpeg: a vast number of formats are supported. A compiled ffmpeg binary is provided for Windows and Linux (32bit). If support on another platform is required check the documentation of JAVE or disable transcoding (trough configuration) and perform it manually .

Method Detail

transcode

public static void transcode(java.lang.String source,
                             java.lang.String target)
Transcode the source file to target using the requested number of channels and sampling rate.

Parameters:
source - The path of the source file.
target - The path of the target file. A stereo stream can be down mixed to a mono stream. Converting a mono stream to a stereo stream results in a file with two channels with the same data.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the source file can not be read or the target file is not writable.

transcode

public static void transcode(java.lang.String source,
                             java.lang.String target,
                             java.lang.Integer channels,
                             java.lang.Integer samplingRate)
Transcode the source file to target using the requested number of channels and sampling rate.

Parameters:
source - The path of the source file.
target - The path of the target file.
channels - The number of channels target should have. A stereo stream can be down mixed to a mono stream. Converting a mono stream to a stereo stream results in a file with two channels with the same data.
samplingRate - The sampling rate the target file should have;
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the source file can not be read or the target file is not writable.

transcodingRequired

public static boolean transcodingRequired(java.lang.String target)
Checks if transcoding is required: it fetches information about the file 'target' and checks if the file has the expected format, number of channels and sampling rate. If not then transcoding is required. If target is not found then transcoding is also required.

Parameters:
target - the path to the transcoded file or file to transcode
Returns:
false if the file is already transcoded as per the requested parameters, false otherwise.

transcodingRequired

public static boolean transcodingRequired(java.lang.String target,
                                          java.lang.Integer channels,
                                          java.lang.Integer samplingRate)
Checks if transcoding is required: it fetches information about the file 'target' and checks if the file has the expected format, number of channels and sampling rate. If not then transcoding is required. If target is not found then transcoding is also required.

Parameters:
target - the path to the transcoded file or file to transcode
channels - Defines the number of channels the transcoded file should have.
samplingRate - Defines the samplingrate the transcoded file should have.
Returns:
false if the file is already transcoded as per the requested parameters, false otherwise.

getInfo

public static it.sauronsoftware.jave.AudioInfo getInfo(java.lang.String file)
Returns information about an audio file: the sampling rate, the number of channels, the decoder, ...

Parameters:
file - the file to get the info for
Returns:
the info for the file.
